item.title: 澳大利亚央行发出更多降息信号，但步伐未定
item.description: 澳大利亚央行董事会在本月降息时判断，未来一年可能需要进一步放宽政策，而步伐可能是渐进式的，也可能是更快的，这取决于经济数据的流动情况。【原文：Australia's central bank board judged further policy easing would likely be needed over the coming year when it cut rates this month, and the pace could be gradual or quicker depending on the flow of economic data.】

item.title: 美国从周三起征收新的高额关税，印度准备应对出口冲击
item.description: 美国国土安全部的一份通知证实，华盛顿将从周三起对所有原产于印度的商品征收 25% 的额外关税，从而加大了对这个亚洲国家的贸易压力。【原文：Indian exporters are bracing for disruptions after a U.S. Homeland Security notification confirmed Washington will impose an additional 25% tariff on all Indian-origin goods from Wednesday, ramping up trade pressure on the Asian nation.】

item.title: 特朗普解雇美联储库克的法律前提是什么？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周一史无前例地下令解除丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）理事的联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve Board of Governors）职务，称有关她所拥有的房产抵押的问题是其政府刑事调查的对象，这足以成为解除其职务的理由。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday took the unprecedented step of ordering Governor Lisa Cook removed from the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, saying questions about the mortgages on properties she owns that are the subject of a criminal probe by his administration are sufficient cause for dismissal.】

item.title: 韩国豪赌重振陷入困境的美国造船业，向特朗普示好
item.description: 韩国总统李在明（Lee Jae Myung）在其首次正式美国之行中倚重 "让美国造船业再次伟大 "的承诺，而这两个盟国却在贸易和安全协议的其他细节上争论不休。【原文：South Korean President Lee Jae Myung is leaning on promises to "Make America Shipbuilding Great Again" during his first official U.S. trip, as the two allies wrangle over other details of their trade and security agreements.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称 Tekscend Photomask 东京 IPO 目标估值 20 亿美元
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，日本芯片制造用光罩制造商 Tekscend Photomask 首次公开募股的目标估值为 3000 亿日元（约合 20 亿美元）。【原文：Tekscend Photomask, a Japanese manufacturer of photomasks for chipmaking, is aiming for a valuation of 300 billion yen ($2 billion) in its initial public offering, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 文件显示，Elliott 关联公司成为 Citgo 拍卖的领跑者
item.description: 一名美国法院官员周一称，对冲基金埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）的一家附属公司对委内瑞拉炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 的母公司提出了最佳竞标，而矿商 Gold Reserve 领导的集团此前曾被推荐为胜出者。【原文：A U.S. court officer said on Monday an affiliate of hedge fund Elliott Investment Management made the best bid for the parent of Venezuela-owned refiner Citgo Petroleum, against a group led by miner Gold Reserve previously recommended as the winner.】

item.title: 日本财务大臣表示，日本仍对外汇走势感到担忧
item.description: 日本财务大臣加藤胜信（Katsunobu Kato）周二表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布解除美联储理事职务后，日元走强，日本仍对外汇走势感到担忧。【原文：Japan remains alarmed over foreign exchange movement, Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said on Tuesday, after the yen strengthened following U.S. President Donald Trump's announcement of the removal of a Federal Reserve governor.】

item.title: 卢特尼克称本周将更新日本对美投资 5500 亿美元的情况
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）表示，美国将于本周宣布日本对美投资 5500 亿美元的消息，据报道，日本的一位高级贸易特使正计划访问华盛顿，以正式确定这项交易。【原文：The United States will make an announcement this week on Japan's $550 billion investment in the U.S., Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said, as a top Japanese trade envoy is reportedly planning to visit Washington to formalise the deal.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行认为未来将有更多降息举措，但步伐未定
item.description: 路透社悉尼8月26日电）澳大利亚央行董事会在本月降息时判断，未来一年可能需要进一步放宽政策，根据经济数据的流动情况，步伐可能会渐进或加快。【原文：SYDNEY, Aug 26 (Reuters) - Australia's central bank board judged further policy easing would likely be needed over the coming year when it cut rates this month, and the pace could be gradual or quicker depending on the flow of economic data.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁对征收数字税的国家征收更多关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周一威胁那些征收数字税的国家，如果这些国家不取消此类立法，将对其商品征收 "后续的额外关税"。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday threatened countries that have digital taxes with "subsequent additional tariffs" on their goods if those nations do not remove such legislation.】

item.title: 特朗普解雇美联储主席库克后美元下跌
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示将解除美联储理事丽莎-库克的职务后，美元在周二亚洲早盘交易中回吐涨幅。【原文：The U.S. dollar surrendered gains in early trading in Asia on Tuesday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he was removing Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook from her position for allegedly committing mortgage fraud.】

item.title: 内华达州办公室在大范围 "网络安全事件 "后关闭
item.description: 美国内华达州州长表示，在发生不明 "网络安全事件 "后，该州办公室已关闭，网站已下线，电话线路也已中断。【原文：The governor of the U.S. state of Nevada says that offices have closed, websites are offline and phone lines are patchy following an unspecified "network security incident."】

item.title: 特朗普对美联储的最新攻击导致美元和国债下跌
item.description: 美元和美国国债在周二的亚洲交易中下滑，此前唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布解除美联储理事的职务，这削弱了人们对美国资产的信心。【原文：The dollar and U.S. Treasuries slid in Asian trading on Tuesday after President Donald Trump announced he was removing a Federal Reserve governor, which undermined confidence in U.S. assets.】

item.title: VIEW 分析师对特朗普解雇美联储库克的反应
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一采取了史无前例的行动，解雇了第一位担任美联储理事的非裔美国女性丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook），原因是她被指控在抵押贷款借款方面存在不当行为。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday took the unprecedented action of firing Lisa Cook, the first African-American woman to serve as a Federal Reserve governor, over claims of mortgage borrowing impropriety.】

item.title: 巴西法官对暂停大豆种植禁令发出禁令
item.description: 巴西联邦法官周一发布禁令，暂时中止反垄断监督机构 CADE 的一项决定，该决定曾命令世界最大大豆出口国的谷物贸易商停止所谓的 "大豆暂停 "计划。【原文：A Brazilian federal judge granted an injunction on Monday temporarily suspending a decision from antitrust watchdog CADE that had ordered grain traders in the world's largest soy exporter halt their so-called "soy moratorium" program.】

item.title: 特朗普解雇美联储库克，指控其在抵押贷款表格上做虚假陈述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一采取了史无前例的行动，解雇了第一位担任美联储理事的非裔美国女性丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook），原因是她被指控在抵押贷款借款方面存在不当行为。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday took the unprecedented action of firing Lisa Cook, the first African-American woman to serve as a Federal Reserve governor, over claims of mortgage borrowing impropriety.】

item.title: 俄罗斯-乌克兰供应担忧引发石油价格升至两周高点后回落
item.description: 周二，油价在上一交易日大涨近2%后有所回落，原因是交易商密切关注俄乌冲突的发展，以防对该地区的燃料供应造成潜在影响。【原文：Oil prices edged down on Tuesday after surging nearly 2% in the previous session, as traders kept a close watch on developments in the Russia-Ukraine conflict for the potential impact on fuel supplies from the region.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰拟以 3.46 亿美元出售日产汽车后，日产汽车股价下跌 6.5
item.description: 在陷入困境的日本汽车制造商日产汽车的第二大股东梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）表示将于周一出售所持的 3.8% 股份后，该公司股价在周二上午暴跌 6.5%。【原文：Shares in struggling Japanese automaker Nissan Motor plunged 6.5% on Tuesday morning after its second-largest shareholder, Mercedes-Benz , said it would sell its 3.8% stake on Monday.】

item.title: 特朗普称将解除美联储理事库克的职务
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，他将解除美联储理事丽莎-库克在美联储董事会的职务。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he was removing Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook from her position on the Fed's board of directors.】

item.title: 现代汽车集团在美投资增至 260 亿美元
item.description: 韩国现代汽车集团（Hyundai Motor Group）周二在一份声明中表示，将把对美国的投资从之前计划的 210 亿美元增加到 260 亿美元。【原文：South Korea's Hyundai Motor Group said in a statement on Tuesday it is increasing U.S. investment to $26 billion from a previously planned $21 billion.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯称低中性利率时代尚未结束
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周一表示，根据他对数据的解读，基本利率持续走低的时代似乎并未结束。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said Monday that the era of persistently low underlying interest rates does not appear to be over, based on his reading of the data.】

item.title: 因付款纠纷，福克斯频道可能从周三起关闭 YouTube TV
item.description: YouTube 周一表示，它正在与福克斯公司商谈续签内容合作关系，但这家媒体公司要求的报酬高于提供类似内容的合作伙伴。【原文：YouTube said on Monday it is in talks to renew a content partnership with Fox , but the media company is asking for payments above those received by partners providing comparable content.】

item.title: 成本上升，澳大利亚杂货商 Coles 年度利润不及预期
item.description: 澳大利亚 Coles 集团周二公布的年度利润低于预期，原因是较高的运营和融资成本以及较低的烟草销售抵消了超市部门强劲的销售增长。【原文：Australia's Coles Group reported a lower-than-expected annual profit on Tuesday, as higher operating and financing costs alongside lower tobacco sales offset strong sales growth at its Supermarkets division.】

item.title: 澳大利亚福特斯库公司（Fortescue）年度利润下降 41
item.description: 澳大利亚福特斯库公司（Fortescue）周二报告称，由于担心供应过剩和中国需求放缓，铁矿石价格继续承压，该公司的年度利润下降了 41%。【原文：Australia's Fortescue reported a 41% drop in its annual profit on Tuesday, as prices of iron ore remained under pressure due to oversupply concerns and slowing China demand.】

item.title: 韩联社：韩国企业将在美投资1500亿美元
item.description: 韩联社周二援引商业团体韩国工业联合会（Federation of Korean Industries）主席Ryu Jin的话报道称，韩国企业将在美国投资约1500亿美元。【原文：South Korean companies will invest around $150 billion in the United States, Yonhap news agency reported on Tuesday, citing Ryu Jin, chairman of the business group Federation of Korean Industries.】

item.title: 巴西银行敦促就社交媒体上有关美国制裁的帖子采取法律行动
item.description: 据路透社看到的一份日期为周五的文件显示，巴西银行（Banco do Brasil）已要求巴西总检察长对虚假指控采取行动，这些指控称巴西银行即将面临美国政府的制裁，因为巴西银行的一名客户是根据美国《马格尼茨基法案》（Magnitsky Act）受到制裁的一名法官。【原文：Banco do Brasil has asked Brazil's solicitor general to act against false claims that allege it is poised to face sanctions by the U.S. government because one of its clients is a judge sanctioned under the U.S. Magnitsky Act, according to a document dated Friday and seen by Reuters.】

item.title: LinkedIn 深化视频广告推广，挖掘更多出版商和创作者以刺激增长
item.description: LinkedIn 正在扩大其视频广告计划，增加新的发布商和创作者主导的节目，以吸引营销资金。【原文：LinkedIn is expanding its video advertising program, adding new publishers and creator-led shows to draw marketing dollars.】

item.title: 特斯拉在 2.43 亿美元自动驾驶判决败诉前拒绝 6000 万美元和解协议
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的电动汽车公司特斯拉（Tesla）拒绝了一项6000万美元的和解方案，该方案涉及2019年一辆配备自动驾驶系统的Model S车型发生致命车祸的诉讼，而陪审团本月对此案做出了2.43亿美元的裁决。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk’s electric vehicle company Tesla rejected a $60 million settlement proposal in a lawsuit over the 2019 fatal crash of an Autopilot-equipped Model S before a jury this month awarded a $243 million verdict in the case.】

item.title: AirTrunk 完成 104 亿美元再融资，以支持亚太地区和日本的增长
item.description: 超大规模约会中心公司 AirTrunk 周二表示，该公司已经完成了 160 亿澳元（104.0 亿美元）的再融资，希望借此加快在亚太和日本地区的发展。【原文：Hyperscale date centre firm AirTrunk said on Tuesday it has closed an A$16 billion ($10.40 billion) refinancing as its looks to accelerate growth in the Asia Pacific and Japan region.】

item.title: Skyworks Solutions 任命 AMD 高管 Philip Carter 为首席财务官
item.description: Skyworks Solutions 周一表示，Philip Carter 将从 9 月 8 日起重新加入这家芯片制造商，担任首席财务官。【原文：Skyworks Solutions said on Monday Philip Carter will rejoin the chipmaker as its chief financial officer, effective September 8.】
